item.title: Natasha add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I know how people are, with their habits of mind. Most will sail through from cradle to grave with a conscience clean as snow...I know people. Most have no earthly notion of the price of a snow-white conscience." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "What is freedom of expression? Without the freedom to offend, it ceases to exist." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "We are described into corners, and then we must describe ourselves out of corners." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "The American way of life is not sustainable. It doesnâ€™t acknowledge that there is a world beyond America. " -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Natasha add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Normal, in our house, is like a blanket too short for a bed--sometimes it covers you just fine, and other times it leaves you cold and shaking; and worst of all, you never know which of the two it's going to be." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Natasha add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams
